RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 1 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Purse 70000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, VA RESTRICTED, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since Augus t 2 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Condition Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FRIGHTLAND was rank early on the inside, then settled and rated while saving ground, eased out on the turn and came four wide into the lane, made a bid and went on even terms for command by the furlong marker, then edged clear and held off the late closing SEVEN BRIDGES ROAD to propve best, driving. SEVEN BRIDGES ROAD was allowed to settle on the outside, three to four wide on the turn and came five wide into the lane and closed well on the outside, second best. OCCASIONAL MOON pressed the early pace two wide, made a bid on the turn and shook clear by the quarter pole, then was headed by the furlong marker and kept on but faded late, bested rest. LOOKINASSAH was void of early speed, angled out in the lane and had a belated rally. DOCTOR NASH chased the pace two wide and weakened. PHILEAS FOGG set a pressured pace on the inside and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Frightland
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank early, rated inside, eased out, came 4 wide, bid, clear

ENTRY.NAME: Doctor Nash
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Occasional Moon
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 2 wide, bid 2 wide, shook clear, late fade,best rest

ENTRY.NAME: Phileas Fogg
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Seven Bridges Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3-4 wide turn, came 5 wide, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Lookinassah
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, angled out stretch, belatedly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Bert Allen S. COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 2 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 93. Stakes Purse 150000. INNER TURF FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD. (Registered Virginia Bred/Virginia Sired or Virginia Certified). No nomination or starting fee, with $400 to enter. Supplementary nominations of $1,500 each (which include entry fees) may be made at the time of entry. $150,000 (which includes $50,000 from VA Bred Fund), with 60% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three-year-olds 122 lbs.; Older 126 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstake at one mile or over since January 1, 2 lbs., $40,000 other than maiden, claiming or starter at one mile or over on the turf in 2023, 4 lbs. Starters and riders to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 18, 2023 WITH 20 NOMINATIONS. (Rail at 37 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PASSION PLAY stalked the pace from the rail to the far turn, angled out to overtake the pacesetters midway on the final bend, drifted out at the head of the lane and dug-in down the stretch to hold off the two closers at the line in a game effort. PALIO reserved off the leaders for the first half mile, rallied four wide turning or home, closed willingly and could not get to the winner despite surging late. WOW WHATA SUMMER slow early to be at the rear of the field, saved ground to the far turn, tipped around the stopping pacesetters, dove back to the rail inside the drifting winner and finished well up the fence in tight going. JOLLY BY GOLLY reserved for the first half along the fence to track the pace, lost position in the turn and passed tired rivals in the lane. SUBURBAN PRINCE set a pressured pace to the quarter pole and faded in the drive. AIN'T DA BEER COLD pressed the pace down the backside and came up empty on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Jolly by Golly
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, dropped back, lost position, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Wow Whata Summer
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground, tipped out, dropped in, rail rally

ENTRY.NAME: Passion Play
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace inside, cleared, determined drive, gamely

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Mr. & Mrs. C. Oliver Iselin III

ENTRY.NAME: Palio
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, circled 4w, closed willingly, surged late, not in time

ENTRY.NAME: Suburban Prince
ENTRY.OWNER: Wonderland Racing Stables LLC Davis Mark and Leatherman Ty
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, set pressured pace, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Ain't Da Beer Cold
ENTRY.OWNER: Spencer Matt Cox Kelly Jo and Bonuccelli Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, through early,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 3 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 70000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, VA RESTRICTED, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $20,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 2 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Condition Eligibility). (Rail at 37 feet). on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMART STRIKER was well rated on the inside, eased out and came four wide into the lane, made a bid and had a long drive to the inside of ANAMNESTIC and prevailed late to prove best, driving. ANAMNESTIC tracked the pace two wide, made a four wide bid leaving the turn to take over, then had a long drive with the winner and missed. SOCIALLONGDISTANCE tracked the pace on the inside, eased out on the turn and came four wide into the drive, finished willingly but had no kick, bested rest. K P ALL SYSTEMS GO was reserved two wide, angled in by the three sixteenths and improved late up the inside. ADMIRAL'S WAVE was settled two to three wide on the turn, came six wide into the lane and had no rally. CRAFTY KING was settled early on the inside, swung out five wide leaving the turn and had no rally. BASSANIO (GB) vied for the lead on the inside and weakened. MICROSECOND vied for the lead three wide and weakened. PAT'SSEWINGMACHINE was settled back on the inside and failed to respond. STAR RULES was reserved early on the inside and never threatened.

ENTRY.NAME: Pat'ssewingmachine
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back inside, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Sociallongdistance
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, eased out, came 4 wide, no kick, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Crafty King
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, swung 5 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Star Rules
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Smart Striker
ENTRY.COMMENT: well rated inside, came 4 wide, bid, long drive, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: K P All Systems Go
ENTRY.OWNER: Red Storm Stable Photos Finish LLC and Englehart Jeffrey S
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved 2 wide, angled in, improved inside,

ENTRY.NAME: Admiral's Wave
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 2-3 wide turn, came 6 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Bassanio (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Microsecond
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Anamnestic
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 2 wide, bid 4 wide upper, long drive, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 4 5 1/2F Outer turf CR: 69. Maiden Claiming Purse 32000. OUTER TURF FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $12,500 In Last 5 Starts). (Rail at 107 feet). Turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five and One Half Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUBBA CHROME stalked the pace from the fence through the turn, angled to the clear turning for home and drew off convincingly. REAP WHAT YOU SOW reserved off the pace racing three wide in the turn, commenced a rally midway on the turn, angled out to the seven path down the lane and closed well to be up for the place. CITY HUMOR stalked the pace from two wide in the second pairing, made a bid in upper stretch and kept on well to narrowly miss the place. MONCRIEF pressed the pace to the top of the lane and was out finished down the stretch. HEART OF FIRE reserved to race between horses in the third set around the turn and lacked a closing kick. GAMING SOUL unhurried for the first half mile and showed late interest with a mild gain in the stretch. BIG BOULDER well placed along the rail to contend and lacked a response when called upon for the drive. THEOLOVESAWINNER chased the leaders from the rail and continued on one-paced. SERGEANT SHERMAN raced near the rear to upper stretch and passed tiring rivals in the lane. SHAMELESS APPEAL never menaced. TOUGH ENOUGH set a pressured pace through the turn and faltered. ORVILLE STREET was always outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Theolovesawinner
ENTRY.COMMENT: rail trip, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Bubba Chrome
ENTRY.OWNER: Phantom Star Stable and Gilkey Mark
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, angled clear, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Tough Enough
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Orville Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor, outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Big Boulder
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Sergeant Sherman
ENTRY.COMMENT: passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Heart of Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, between rivals, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Moncrief
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, even late, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: City Humor
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, bid, missed place

ENTRY.NAME: Gaming Soul
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, mild gain

ENTRY.NAME: Reap What You Sow
ENTRY.COMMENT: rally 3w, angled 7w, closed well, up for place

ENTRY.NAME: Shameless Appeal
ENTRY.COMMENT: never menaced

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 5 1M Inner turf CR: 72. Maiden Special Weight Purse 60000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $25,000 In Last 5 Starts). (Rail at 37 feet). ile).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHIMSICALLY was away alertly, then rated kindly behind the pace setters on the inside, tipped out two wide leaving the turn to make a bid, responded well and took over nearing the furlong marker, then ducked in under right handed crop while clear into the path of CARINA NEBULA, then was corrected and remained clear to the wire. HEKATE was reserved early on the inside, saved ground on the turn, angled out leaving the furlong marker and closed well to gain the place award. CARINA NEBULA set the pace on the inside, then was headed leaving the turn, then checked by the furlong marker and shifted off the inside, then just missed the place award. NO CONSEQUENCES was void of early speed, came six wide into the lane and had a late rally. COACH SESSA was allowed to settle on the inside, angled out in the lane and had no kick. SINTRA was settled early two to three wide, came five wide into the lane and had no rally. THE AMAZING MIZZEN tracked the pace two wide, made a three wide bid on the turn but came up empty in the drive. BEYOND OSCAR stalked the early pace three wide, pressed the pace two wide and then weakened in the drive. The rider on the number eight CARINA NEBULA claimed foul against the number four WHIMSICALLY for interference in the stretch, after the STEWARDS reviewed the replays they allowed to OBJECTION and disqualified the winner and placed her third.

ENTRY.NAME: No Consequences
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, came 6 wide, late rally,

ENTRY.NAME: The Amazing Mizzen
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 2 wide, bid 3 wide, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Coach Sessa
ENTRY.OWNER: Madaket Stables LLC and Doheny Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, angled out, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Whimsically
ENTRY.OWNER: Haymarket Farm LLC Ingordo David Manganaro Bloodstock LBD Stable LLC and Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, well placed inside, bid 2 wide, ducked in 1/8,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Hekate
ENTRY.OWNER: First Melody Racing LLC and Breslin John
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, saved ground turn, angled out, closed, got 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond Oscar
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3 wide, pressed 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Carina Nebula
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, headed upper, checked 1/8, angled out, miss 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Sintra
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3 wide turn, came 5 wide, no rally,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Nellie Mae Cox S. COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 6 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 93. Stakes Purse 150000. INNER TURF FOR FILLIES AND MARES, THREE-YEARS-OLD AND UPWARD (REGISTERED VIRGINIA BRED/SIRED OR VIRGINIA CERTIFIED). No nomination or starting fee, with $400 to enter. Supplementary nominations of $1,500 each (which include the entry fee) may be made at time of entry. $150,000 (which includes $50,000 from VA Bred Fund), with 60% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three-year-olds 122 lbs.; Older 126 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstake, 2 lbs.; two races other than maiden, claiming or starter at one mile or over on the turf in 2022-23, 4 lbs. Starters and riders to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 18, 2023 WITH27 NOMINATIONS. (Rail at 37 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNRULY JULIE rated just off the leader through the first turn, pulled to the lead down the backside, opened a clear advantage and held the closers safe in the drive. NAVAL EMPIRE reserved off the pace down the backside, made a steady gain through the turn and rallied down the lane but ran out of time. GALILEI well placed stalking the pace through the final bend and failed to gain ground in the drive. EIGHT DANZAS slow early to be at the rear of the field, waited to mount a bid through the final bend while stuck behind a wall of three rivals and mounted a belated rally down the stretch. PRINCESS THEOREM saved ground while tracking the pace from the fence, tipped around a tiring rival in the turn to be called upon from between horses and lacked a closing response. CONTINENTALCONGRES showed speed leading the field through the first turn and steadily faded. AMPLIO ESQUEMA was never a threat. I'M GITTIN THERE prominently placed to the far turn and tired dropping through the field to the back.

ENTRY.NAME: Princess Theorem
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, split rivals, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Eight Danzas
ENTRY.OWNER: Paladin of PA and Fox Tale Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, waited turn, best stride late

ENTRY.NAME: Continentalcongres
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed, steady fade

ENTRY.NAME: Amplio Esquema
ENTRY.COMMENT: never menaced, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Naval Empire
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson, R. Larry and R. D. M. Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, steady gain, too late

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Gittin There
ENTRY.COMMENT: prominently placed, through early, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Unruly Julie
ENTRY.COMMENT: pulled to lead, cleared, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Galilei
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, stalked pace, failed to gain

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Meadow Stable S. COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 7 5 1/2F Outer turf CR: 96. Stakes Purse 150000. OUTER TURF FOR THREE-YEARS-OLD AND UPWARD. (For Registered Virginia Bred/Virginia Sired or Virginia Certified). No nomination or starting fee, with $400 to enter. Supplementary nominations of $1,500 each (which includes entry fee) may be made at time of entry. $150,000 (which includes $50,000 from VA Bred Fund), with 60% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three-year-olds 122 lbs. Older 126 lbs. Non-winners of a Sweepstake since December1, 2 lbs.; $40,000 other than maiden, claiming or starter on the turf in 2023, 4 lbs. Starters and riders to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 18, 2023 WITH 28 NOMINATIONS. (RRa il at 107 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DETERMINED KINGDOM dueled for the lead on the inside, made a bid leaving the turn to draw clear, then drifted out late and held sway to prove best, driving. CYNERGY'S STAR was reserved two wide, came four wide into the lane and closed well but too late. SPIRITED SOL was settled on the inside, then finished well on the inside but needed more. NEXT EPISODE was rated three wide on the turn, came five wide into the lane and rallied. WHENIGETTOHEAVEN tracked the pace two to three wide on the turn, came four wide into the lane and faded in the drive. BOLDOR was reserved early, came six wide into the lane and had no significant rally. GRATEFUL BRED rushed up to duel for the lead three wide, then two wide on the turn and weakened in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Whenigettoheaven
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, 2-3 wide turn, came 4 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Boldor
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, came 6 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Spirited Sol
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside, finished well inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Determined Kingdom
ENTRY.OWNER: D Hatman Thoroughbreds and Kingdom Bloodstock, Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, bid upper, drew clear, drifted late, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Grateful Bred
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up, dueled 3 wide, 2 wide turn, weakened stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Next Episode
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 3 wide, came 5 wide, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Cynergy's Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved 2 wide, came 4 wide, closed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Jamestown S. COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 8 5 1/2F Outer turf CR: 75. Stakes Purse 125000. OUTER TURF FOR TWO-YEAR-OLDS (REGISTERED VIRGINIA BRED/VIRGINIA SIRED). No nomination or starting fee, with $400 to enter. Supplementary nominations of $1,500 each (which include entry fee) may be made at time of entry. $125,000 Guaranteed, with 60% to owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Colts and Geldings, 122 lbs. Fillies, 119 lbs. Non-winners of a race other than maiden or claiming, 2 lbs. Starters and riders to be named through the ent ry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 18, 2023 WITH 17 NOMINATIONS. (Rail at 107 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOW MILEAGE tracked the pace from mid-pack to the top of the lane and mounted a decisive closing rally to be going away at the wire. WORK HARD unhurried early to be at the rear of the main body to the head of the stretch, and closed willingly to be up late for the place. THURSDAY GIRL stalked the pace from three wide, made a bid turning for home and was outkicked down the lane. STILL TEMPER broke alertly, was taken in hand to settle off the leaders stalking through the turn and made a mild bid in the drive. BUZZAWAY slow early to be at the rear of the main body by open lengths, raced wide in the turn and continued to get out down the lane finishing on the outside fence. AFTERNEATH broke through the gate pre-race, reloaded and went to the lead right from the start, was pressured through the turn and flattened out coming home. DONATE LIFE showed speed for the first three-eighths and came up empty. FIELDING LEWIS was always outrun.

ENTRY.NAME: Buzzaway
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, raced wide, drifted far wide

ENTRY.NAME: Low Mileage
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, rally upper, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Still Temper
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke alertly, settled, well placed, mild bid

ENTRY.NAME: Work Hard
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, late gain, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Afterneath
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke thru gate, speed, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Donate Life
ENTRY.OWNER: HnR Nothhaft Horse Racing LLC and Kingdom Bloodstock Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed, through early,

ENTRY.NAME: Thursday Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3w, bid, outkicked

ENTRY.NAME: Fielding Lewis
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Camptown S. COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 9 5 1/2F Outer turf CR: 94. Stakes Purse 150000. OUTER TURF FOR FILLIES AND MARES, THREE-YEARS-OLD AND UPWARD (FOR REGISTERED VIRGINIA BRED/VIRGINIA SIRED OR VIRGINIA CERTIFIED). No nomination or starting fee with $400 to enter. Supplementary nominations of $1,500 each (which includes the entry fee) may be made at time of entry. $150,000 (which includes $50,000 from VA Bred Fund), with 60% going to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth and 3% to fifth. Weights: Three-year-olds 122 lbs.; Older 126 lbs. Non-winners of a Sw eepstake since December 1, 2 lbs.; $40,000 other than maiden, claiming or starter on the turf in 2023, 4 lbs. Starters and riders to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. CLOSED FRIDAY, AUGUST 18, 2023 WITH 31 NOMINATIONS. (Rail at 107 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHAMBEAU dueled for the early lead three wide and made a two wide bid on the turn to take over, then drew out leaving the turn and remained clear to the wire to prove best under a mild drive. SPUN GLASS was reserved early on the outside, came six wide into the lane and closed well to be clearly second best. HOLLYWOOD WALK was rated early two to three wide, came five wide into the lane and made a bid but needed more, bested rest. LOST MY SOCK stalked the pace four wide, made a three wide bid on the turn but faded in the drive. SWEET GRACIE was reserved early, came wide into the lane and had no kick. PUPPYMONKEYBABY passed the tiring rivals. RAMBERT stalked the pace two wide and weakened. AISHA R N chased the pace on the inside and weakened. LIQUIDATOR dueled for the lead on the inside and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Liquidator
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, faltered

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Gracie
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, came wide upper stretch, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Rambert
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 2 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Hollywood Walk
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated 2-3 wide, came 5 wide, bid, bested rest

ENTRY.NAME: Chambeau
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3 wide, bid 2 wide, drew clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Spun Glass
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved outside, came 6 wide upper stretch, closed, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Lost My Sock
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 4 wide, bid 3 wide, faded stretch,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: COLONIAL DOWNS RACE 10 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 69. Maiden Special Weight Purse 60000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For Less Than $25,000 In Last 5 Starts). (Rail at 37 feet). One Sixteenth).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FULMINEO unhurried for the run down the backside, circled three wide in the turn to close on the leaders, and finished fast to be going away at the wire. ROUNDTOP tracked the leaders from striking distance to the far turn, ranged up to engage the leader in upper stretch, drifted in down the lane while vying for the lead in deep stretch and finished well but could not hold off the winner. DEADPAN set a well rated pace to the turn, dug in gamely when engaged turning for home, drifted out a bit in the lane and kept on in a good effort. MILL STREET unprepared at the start to break a step slow, trailed to the far turn and showed good late interest to be gaining in the lane. ST JAMES THE GREAT stalked the pace down the backside, loomed up on the turn, flattened out in the lane while being crowded by rivals in mid-stretch. SAISIR LE JOUR prominent in the early going, was taken in hand to settle off the pace while saving ground along the rail and failed to mount a closing bid. CHACHACHING was set to a drive entering the final turn and failed to menace. KINGDOM FORCE tracked the pacesetter from the rail for the first half mile and tired. TOUR THE CITY was through early and dropped out to be outrun. THE RIDER OF ST JAMS THE GREAT CLAIMED FOUL FOR INTERFERENCE IN THE STRETCH RUN, UPON REVIEW BY THE STEWARDS NO CHANGE WAS MADE. THE FINAL MARGINS WERE ENTERED BY THIS CHART CALLER DUE TO A MALFUNCTION IN THE PHOTO FINISH EQUIPMENT.

ENTRY.NAME: Tour the City
ENTRY.COMMENT: through early, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Kingdom Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Fulmineo
ENTRY.OWNER: Starlight Racing and Grier Mark B
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, circled 3w, closed fast, going away

ENTRY.NAME: Saisir Le Jour
ENTRY.COMMENT: prominent early, taken in hand, saved ground, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Mill Street
ENTRY.COMMENT: unprepared start, slow early, good late interest

ENTRY.NAME: Roundtop
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, bid, lugged in stretch, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Chachaching
ENTRY.COMMENT: never menaced, long drive

ENTRY.NAME: Deadpan
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace, well rated, gamely, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: St James the Great
ENTRY.OWNER: Serio Racing Stables USA Steeplechase R and K Racing LLC Willis Paul and Willis
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, loomed, crowded stretch, flattened out,
